subject: Re: Tenable WAS Findings (November 2025)
preview: Hi Richard,  Happy New Year!  We’re back in action and have started working through the findings outlined in the CSV.  Regarding the scanner IPs: we’ve reached out to Kinsta to whitelist them for

full_threads.body:
Hi Richard,

Happy New Year!

We’re back in action and have started working through the findings outlined in the CSV.

Regarding the scanner IPs: we’ve reached out to Kinsta to whitelist them for the sites hosted there now that the holiday security protocols are being relaxed. fnqib.com.au, however, doesn’t appear to be hosted on Kinsta - it’s not a WordPress site, and we only manage the WordPress sites.

I’ll let you know as soon as the Kinsta sites are ready so you can attempt a re-scan of those affected sites.

Hi Adriane,

Understood as it is the holidays season. I doubt there is any Critical or High findings but if there is, do address those first. The Mediums and Lows can be remediated later, no worries.

Also noted on the stricter security protocol/firewall rulesfor the Kinsta servers. Do inform them to whitelist the scanner IPs once the holiday season is over. Thank you.

Wishing you a Merry Christmas & a Happy New Year!

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

Adriane here, stepping in for Allie.

Just a quick note: we’ve been working on the other issues outlined in the CSV sent over last Tuesday. However, since the team is currently on holiday break, we likely won’t be finishing all those items immediately - it may take a little while.

Regarding the 403 Forbidden errors and IP blocking: that was actually triggered by Kinsta’s servers. They implemented stricter security protocols/firewalls for the holiday period which caused those blocks.

Hope you have a wonderful holidays!

Hi Allie,

Kindly find latest findings as attached for all the sites. Noticed some sites still show the error 403. Appreciate if you could look into it and whitelist the scanner IP for the affected sites accordingly.

Additionally, the scan for site https://www.fnqib.com.au/ experienced a timeout. Could you check if there is any blocking on this site and whitelist accordingly?

Thank you.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:





This e-mail and any attachments are CONFIDENTIAL and may contain legally privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail message, please telephone or e-mail us immediately, delete this message from your system and do not read, copy, distribute, disclose or otherwise use this e-mail message and any attachments. Although The Envest Group believe this e-mail and any attachments to be free of any virus or other defect which may affect your computer, it is the responsibility of the recipient to ensure that it is virus free and The Envest Group does not accept any responsibility for any loss of damage arising in any way from its use.

Hi Richard,

Thanks so much for the update, I’m really glad to hear the 403 error is no longer showing up on your end 😊

Just a quick update from us:
  • Our hosting environment did flag the scanner IPs again as part of its automated security checks, but we’ve already gone ahead and unblocked them.
  • When you have a moment, could you please run the scan again and let us know if everything looks good now?
  • We’ll start reviewing the latest scan results you shared and look into applying the same approach across the other Envest sites, so we can get ahead of this before your scanners hit them.
  • My colleague Adriane, will continue working on the security side and keep you updated as we move things along.

Thanks again for your patience and for working through this with us, we really appreciate the collaboration. Please don’t hesitate to reach out if anything comes up in the meantime 😊

Hi Allie,

Thanks to your patience and swift action, the 403 error no longer appear and the issue seems to have been resolved.

Would be great if you could apply the same whitelist to all the other sites of Envest listed in the report as well as they too face a similar issue.

Attached is the latest scan result of projectunite. Appreciate your help to resolve the new findings detected. I believe the same findings would also appear on the other sites as well so if you could also fix them in the meantime before our scanners it that would be great as well.

Thank you for your help. Hope to hear from you soon.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:





This e-mail and any attachments are CONFIDENTIAL and may contain legally privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient of this e-mail message, please telephone or e-mail us immediately, delete this message from your system and do not read, copy, distribute, disclose or otherwise use this e-mail message and any attachments. Although The Envest Group believe this e-mail and any attachments to be free of any virus or other defect which may affect your computer, it is the responsibility of the recipient to ensure that it is virus free and The Envest Group does not accept any responsibility for any loss of damage arising in any way from its use.

Hi Richard,

Thank you again for the detailed follow-up, this is really helpful.

We’ve checked the latest request headers you shared, and we were able to confirm the root cause once more:
  • The IP 13.210.1.116 (used by the recent scan) was automatically blocked by our firewall

  • This block was triggered because that shared IP attempted 1,027 wp-login requests within a short period to another site’s container, causing the system to auto-flag it for security
  • This is consistent with what we saw earlier, as Tenable appears to rotate between shared IPs within the ranges you provided

Our team has now:
  • Removed 13.210.1.116 from the firewall block list

  • Re-scanned all the IP ranges you shared to ensure none of them are currently blocked

  • Cleared related rules so future requests from these IPs should pass through cleanly
When you have a moment, could you please re-run the scan once more?

If you still encounter the 403 response, feel free to send the new headers or timestamp, we’re keeping a close eye on this until everything is fully resolved for you.

Appreciate your patience and collaboration as we work through this. Happy to continue digging until we get a clean pass.

Hi Allie,

Thanks for the prompt investigation. Really helped to clarify the root cause.

I have just ran another scan as requested which started at 5:52pm. Unfortunately, the result was still the same - still hitting the 403 error. Attached once more the http request and response.

I believe the shared IP has changed this time which triggered the blocking again. Suspect that the scanner dynamically assigns a random available IP from its specified range as below. It is a cloud-based scanner.

13.210.1.64/26
3.106.118.128/25
3.26.100.0/24

Hope this could clarify things further. Let me know if you need anything else to help resolve this. Thank you.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

Thank you for sending through the scan details and headers, that was extremely helpful.

We’ve investigated further on our end and found the cause of the 403 response:
  • The IP 13.210.1.115 (seems to be the shared IP) was automatically blocked by our firewall
  • This happened because the IP appeared to be a shared IP and was flagged for sending 114 wp-login requests within 5 minutes to another site’s container
  • As a result, the system temporarily blocked it, which explains why Tenable was receiving 403 responses during your scan


We’ve now:
  • Removed the IP from the firewall block list
  • Cleared the related rules so the scanner should be able to access the site without interruption

When you have a moment, could you please run the scan again and confirm if you’re no longer seeing the 403 Forbidden response?

Happy to keep working on this with you until everything is running smoothly.

Hi Allie,

Thank you for your updates as well.

I ran the scan on projectunite at 4:00pm and it has just finished 10 minutes ago

I have also attached the HTTP headers and response for your reference on the output generated, related to one of the findings 'Missing X-Content-Type-Options Header'. It should be sufficient for your request but let me know if you need any extra information.

FYI the request made was GET https://projectunite.com.au/

Hope this helps.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

Thank you for the update, and that helps a lot.

We’ve checked again on our end, but we’re still not seeing any requests or user agents from Tenable hitting the site or being blocked in the firewall logs.

To investigate this properly, could you please have Tenable retry the scan and share the exact timestamp of their next attempt?

It would also be really helpful if they can provide any additional details such as:
  • User agent the scanner uses
  • Specific URL or endpoint it’s attempting to access
  • Any request headers or scan identifiers, if available

With this information, we can cross-reference the logs more accurately and confirm where the traffic might be getting filtered.

Happy to keep digging into this with you, just let me know once you have re-run the scan.

Hi Allie,

The tool we are using to scan is Tenable. Hope this helps.

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group



richard.ho@envest.com.au

Visit: envest.com.au
Follow us:

Hi Richard,

Thanks for sending these through

We’ve checked from our end and wanted to share a quick update:
  • We can’t currently see these IP ranges being blocked in the server or firewall logs
  • To investigate further, we just need a bit more detail on the scanner being used (e.g. provider or tool name)
  • With that information, we can check the relevant logs more closely and confirm where the traffic may be getting filtered

Once we have those details, we’re very happy to review again and make any updates needed so you can re-run the scan.

Thanks again, we’ll keep an eye out for your update.

Hi Allie,

Welcome back and thanks for the prompt reply.

You can start off by whitelisting these range of IPs in blue

13.210.1.64/26
3.106.118.128/25
3.26.100.0/24

Once you are done, I will run another scan on projectunite to verify things. Praying this will resolve the issue

Richard Ho
Cyber Security Analyst The Envest Group

Hi Richard,

Jumping in for Adriane, thank you for the detailed update.

Could you please share the IP address (or range) of the scanner you’re using? Once we have that, we can whitelist it to prevent the 403 blocks from Cloudflare and ensure your scan runs smoothly.

Happy to help

action.text: Adriane Roa assigned to Allie Borcena
